intro: Pennellia boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian pennellia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of Bolivia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests and stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a subtle, spicy fragrance when crushed. Pennellia boliviensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential medicinal properties.
